refnamediv.refpurpose: a menu item with a check box.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "active" gboolean : Read / Write "inconsistent" gboolean : Read / Write

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkCheckMenuItem is a menu item that maintains the state of a boolean value in addition to a GtkMenuItem's usual role in activating application code.
A check box indicating the state of the boolean value is displayed at the left side of the GtkMenuItem. Activating the GtkMenuItem toggles the value.

refsect2.title: struct GtkCheckMenuItem
refsect2.para:
The GtkCheckMenuItem struct contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be set by an application.)
guint active; TRUE if the check box is active.

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_new_with_label ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkCheckMenuItem with a label.

listitem.simpara: the string to use for the label.

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_new_with_mnemonic ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkCheckMenuItem containing a label. The label will be created using gtk_label_new_with_mnemonic(), so underscores in label indicate the mnemonic for the menu item.

listitem.simpara: The text of the button, with an underscore in front of the mnemonic character

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_set_state

warning.para: gtk_check_menu_item_set_state is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: This macro is provided to preserve compatibility with older code. New code should use gtk_check_menu_item_set_active() function instead.

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_get_active ()
refsect2.para: Returns whether the check menu item is active. See gtk_check_menu_item_set_active().

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the menu item is checked.

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_set_active ()
refsect2.para: Sets the active state of the menu item's check box.

listitem.simpara: boolean value indicating whether the check box is active.

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_set_show_toggle ()

warning.para: gtk_check_menu_item_set_show_toggle is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Controls whether the check box is shown at all times. Normally the check box is shown only when it is active or while the menu item is selected.

listitem.simpara: boolean value indicating whether to always show the check box.

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_get_inconsistent ()
refsect2.para: Retrieves the value set by gtk_check_menu_item_set_inconsistent().

refsect2.title: gtk_check_menu_item_set_inconsistent ()
refsect2.para: If the user has selected a range of elements (such as some text or spreadsheet cells) that are affected by a boolean setting, and the current values in that range are inconsistent, you may want to display the check in an "in between" state. This function turns on "in between" display. Normally you would turn off the inconsistent state again if the user explicitly selects a setting. This has to be done manually, gtk_check_menu_item_set_inconsistent() only affects visual appearance, it doesn't affect the semantics of the widget.

listitem.simpara: TRUE to display an "inconsistent" third state check

refsect2.title: The "toggled" signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when the state of the check box is changed.
A signal handler can examine the active field of the GtkCheckMenuItem struct to discover the new state.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
